In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` that performs these transformations on a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespace
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscore
    col = replace(col, r"\s|-|_" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

This function takes a string `col` as input and returns the cleaned column name in lowercase with no leading or trailing whitespace and spaces/hyphens replaced with underscores.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("  my column  ")
"my_column"

julia> clean_column("My-Column")
"my_column"
```

This function is designed to work with Julia strings and handles cases where the input string may already be lowercase or does not contain any spaces or hyphens.
